title: Who was K-Pop star Sulli and how did the singer and actress die?
text:
Sulli has passed away (Picture: Han Myung-Gu/WireImage)

K-Pop star Sulli, who found fame when she joined girl band f(x) in 2009, has died aged just 25.

The young star was found dead at 3.20pm local time after her manager went to her house in Sujeong-gu, Seongnam in the Gyeonggi province of South Korea after being unable to contact her.

Fans have already flooded Twitter with heartfelt tributes to the South Korean star, who was also known for her acting career as well as success as a singer.

‘Sulli, I am lost for words,’ wrote one heartbroken fan. ‘You filled my childhood with so many memories.’

Another fan tweeted: ‘Sulli was an amazing artist and incredibly misunderstood. Whenever I think of Sulli I will always remember how beautiful her smile is.’

Who was K-pop star Sulli?

Sulli, whose real name was Choi Jin-ri, was scouted by South Korea’s largest entertainment company, S.M. Entertainment Co. when she was 16 years old and initially forged a career as a young actress.

Sulli has been in the public eye since she was a teenager (Picture: Multi-Bits/Multi-Bits via Getty Images)

Her first foray into acting professionally came in 2005 when she played Princess Seonhwa of Silla in the SBS drama Ballad of Seodong and she was then recruited by S.M. to join their new five-member dance-focused pop group, f(x).

The band was compromised of four other up and coming stars alongside Sulli named Victoria, Amber, Luna and Krystal.

Their debut single as called LA chA TA was released on September 1 2009 and went on to release their first full-length studio album Pinocchio in April 2011.

In 2013, f(x) became the first K-Pop band ever to perform at SXSW in Austin, Texas and a year later they picked up a ‘Group Artist’ award at the 20th Korean Entertainment Arts Awards.

The band continued to enjoy varying degrees of success but Sulli had to take a brief hiatus from the band in 2014 due to mental and physical exhaustion.

Then, in August 2015, Sulli announced she would be leaving the band for good.

Sulli left f(x) for good in 2015 (Picture: Han Myung-Gu/WireImage)

Opening up about her reasons for quitting f(x) during the first episode of her reality show, Jinri Store, in 2018 Sulli confessed: ‘I was under so much pressure. I often felt scared. We [f(x)] felt so much pressure. I did what someone told me to do without knowing the reason.

‘At some point, I started to realise and started to wonder why I should do this and for what I’m doing this… I said I’m exhausted, but no one listened to me,’ the then 24-year-old sadly admitted, before adding, ‘I felt like I was alone.’

Sulli has died aged 25 (Picture: Han Myung-Gu/WireImage)

After her departure from f(x), Sulli pursued her acting career, appearing in a movie called Real, with actor Kim Soo Hyun and and TV dramas To The Beautiful You and Hotel Del Luna.

Sulli won the Best New Star award at the SBS Drama Awards in 2012 for her role as Goo Jae-hee in To The Beautiful You.

Sulli received critical acclaim for her role in To The Beautiful You (Picture: The Chosunilbo JNS/Multi-Bits via Getty Images)

It was announced earlier this year that Sulli would return to her singing career, but this time as a solo artist and she released her debut single, Goblin, in June.

At the beginning of her music video for the single, a description is both Korean and English reads: ‘This is a story about a person with a dissociative disorder. She is with herself and with three other personalities.’

The video then begins with Sulli speaking to the camera, although it is unclear if she is in character or not. She says: ‘They suddenly appeared one day. Maybe it’s just a memory from some characters. Is it because of stress? Or…I don’t know. Sometimes I wonder if ‘They’ are really ‘me’. So who am I really? Did I do something wrong? I just want to end it…That’s what I think sometimes.’

Sulli’s cause of death has yet to be confirmed.
